name: An Intro to Quantum Concepts #2
description:
An Intro to Quantum Concepts #2
===

A quantum operation is a linear transformation, usually written as a unitary matrix, i.e. a matrix whose inverse equals its conjugate transpose.

Task
---
Check whether a matrix
```
a b
c d
```
is unitary, assuming a floating point accuracy of 1e-6. The matrix is given as a list of real numbers ```[a, b, c, d]``` (actual quantum operations use complex numbers, by the way).
